result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:52 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremiah S. Dietrich appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Jr. appeared by video for Jeremiah S. Dietrich. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 098670,
Payable Number: 155671,
Receipt Number: 22R 006605,
Amount: $20.00

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-09-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
